title: Microstructure and Dose Tolerance of Organic-Inorganic Hybrid Perovskite CsxFA1-xPbI3
content: Perovskite characterizes a class of semiconductors with a general chemical formula of ABX3, where A site and B site are cations and X site is the anion. Lead halide perovskite, where B site is occupied by lead and X site is occupied by halides, was first applied in photovoltaic cells in 2009 [1]. The power conversion efficiency (PCE) of lead halide perovskite solar cells (PSCs) has been pushed to above 25% [2], demonstrating great potential for commercial photovoltaic devices.
